content.raw:
Alfredo,

I am modifying `docker-compose.yml` for our purposes and if you planned to have both robots named X1 and X2 to have type X1, then there is mistake in bridge2 initialization:

> ‌

```
bridge2:
    image: osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest
    command: robotName1:=X2 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

I do not know why bridge needs to know the robot configuration \(I guess that name is “must have”\), but I guess it does not matter that much?? You do not have to fix it, but it is probably mistake.

[#!/osrf/subt/src/tunnel\_circuit/docker/docker-compose.yml#lines-95](#!/osrf/subt/src/tunnel_circuit/docker/docker-compose.yml#lines-95)

Alfredo,

I am modifying docker-compose.yml for our purposes and if you planned to have both robots named X1 and X2 to have type X1, then there is mistake in bridge2 initialization:

‌

bridge2:
    image: osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest
    command: robotName1:=X2 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

I do not know why bridge needs to know the robot configuration (I guess that name is “must have”), but I guess it does not matter that much?? You do not have to fix it, but it is probably mistake.
